Astronomy is the study of stars, planets, and other objects in space. It uses math and physics to explain how these objects move and interact. Astronomers observe space using special tools like telescopes. They look at light from distant stars and galaxies to learn more about the universe. This helps us understand our place in the cosmos and how the universe works. Astronomy also inspires us to explore and discover new things. It's like a big puzzle where we keep finding new pieces to help us see the whole picture.

Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects, spaces, and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It involves understanding stars, planets, galaxies, and other celestial bodies, as well as the physics and chemistry that govern their interactions. Astronomers use powerful telescopes and other instruments to collect and analyze data, helping us learn about the universe's origins, evolution, and ultimate fate.

Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects, spaces, and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It involves observation, theory, and mathematics. Astronomers study stars, galaxies, planets, and other celestial bodies. They also examine the physical properties and evolution of these objects. To do this, they use telescopes and other technologies. Astronomy helps us understand the universe and our place in it.
